Students learn in a child-friendly, gender-sensitive, <br>

Administrators and staff, as stewards of the institution, <br>

<h2 id="Back">Background of the School</h2>
<p class="bac">Background
The Bataan School of Fisheries (BSF) is a public school located in Orion, Bataan. <br>
It was established in 1971 through Republic Act 4222, enacted by the 5th Congress<br>
on June 19, 1965, under the supervision of the Director of Vocational Education. <br>
The school is located in Barangay Daan Bago, with a total land area of 14.8 hectares<br>
for the fishpond. Laboratory, 2.08 hectares for mangrove forest, and 6 hectares of<br>
reservation area for the fishing laboratory.<br>
In 1971, the Bataan School of Fisheries opened its gates for its first year of operation.<br>
It offered a Secondary Technical Vocational Program with specialization in Fish Capture,<br>
Fish Culture and Fish Preservation. BSF then expanded its curricular program in 1975 to<br>
offer a three-year Post Secondary Diploma in Fisheries Technology (DFT) with<br>
specialization in Marine Fisheries, Aquaculture, and Fish Processing. However, in 1994, <br>
BSF was placed under TESDA (Technical Education and Skills Development Authority) <br>
supervision through R.A. 7796. During this period, BSF gained accreditation for the<br>
offering of Basic Seamanship, Garments Technology and One-Year Computer Literacy Course<br>
in addition to the FBPS, FPST, and DFT. In 1998, Bataan School of Fisheries opted to<br>
return to the supervision of the Department of Education, Culture, and Sports, Department <br>
of Education (DepEd). BSF also started to conduct TESDA-supervised trade tests for <br>
graduating students in Garment Technology.  <br>
Bataan School of Fisheries gained accreditation in 1999 as an assessment center for Food <br>
Trades and Computer Encoding for graduates of FBPS and the One-Year Computer Literacy Program.<br>
In 2007, BSF was identified as the pilot school for the implementation of the Strengthened <br>
Technical-Vocational Education Program (STEVEP) of the Department of Education. It also started<br>
to conduct TESDA. Supervised Competency Assessment for its graduating high schools.<br>
In addition, in 2008, BSF contracted a Memorandum of Agreement with Bataan Peninsula State <br>
University (BPSU) for the College consortium to offer Bachelor of Science in Fisheries and <br>
Associate in Computer Technology programs. Which then in 2010, Bataan School of Fisheries was<br>
identified as a National Benchmarking School for Department Heads of Fishery Schools throughout<br>
the Philippines.  <br>
Further, in 2012, BSF was identified as a Modelling Tech-Voc School in Fisheries for the Grade 11<br>
and Grade 12 Senior High School of the K-12 Program. There are only 14 schools in the country that<br>
participated in the said Modelling Program of which BSF is one. In 2013, Bataan School of <br>
Fisheries was accredited as a Training and Assessment Center in Fish/Food Processing NCII, Aquaculture<br>
NCII, Aquaculture INC II, Fish Capture NCII, Dressmaking NCII and Food & Beverages NCII.  <br>
At present, the school has 2309 students in both the Junior High School 76 and Senior High School 22<br>
with 98 teachers. Under the supervision of Dr. Marijoy B. Mendoza School Principal III, <br>
and Arvin N. De Dios, Assistant School Principal II.<br> </p>
